str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb, doko dok'-o of the same meaning; to think; by implication, to seem.
Without reason, irrational; contrary to reason, absurd. Irrational.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To send, transmit, permit to go, put forth.
One bound, a prisoner. From desmon; a captive.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
To signify, indicate, give a sign, make known. From sema; to indicate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the same as aiteo; a cause, i.e. reason, crime.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
